sources.name: Incomes across the Distribution Database (Nolan, Thewissen, Roser) in levels
sources.description:
Description:
Data published by

Incomes across the Distribution Database

Data publisher's source

Based on microdata from the Luxembourg Income Study Database

LinkThe entire database was published by Brian Nolan, Stefan Thewissen here https://ourworldindata.org/incomes-across-the-distribution/
RetrievedMay 26, 2016

Additional information

The decile cut-offs  are calculated on the basis of disposable household income. The measure of disposable household income employed in the Luxembourg Income Study is paid employment and self-employment income, capital income, transfer income, which includes social security transfers (work-related insurance transfers, universal benefits, and assistance benefits) and private transfers, minus income taxes and social security contributions. This follows the definitions of the Canberra Group.

variables.name: 1st
variables.description: Household disposable income by income decile for the entire population
variables.timespan: Data coverage differs by country – for some countries data goes back to 1978 while coverage is shorter for some other countries. Data is currently available until 2013.
